sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"准确的，正确的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: accurate, exact, precise, right, true, correct
means: accurate ：指通过谨慎的努力达到符合事实或实际，侧重不同程度的准确性，与事实无出入。
exact ：着重在质与量方面的准确，语气比accurate强。
precise ：侧重极端准确，更强调细节的精确无误。
right ：使用广泛，可与这些词中的correct换用，但常暗示道德、理解、行动等方面的正确。
true ：暗指绝对准确，尤指复制品与原件丝毫不差。
correct ：最常用词，主要指按一定标准或规则来衡量，没有谬误和差错或无缺点错误。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that one is now giving more exact or detailed information

lj.lj_ly: there were not many—five, to be precise.
lj.lj_ls: 数量不多—准确地说，只有五个。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French prescis, from Latin praecis- 'cut short', from the verb praecidere, from prae 'in advance' + caedere 'to cut'

entry.def: You use precise to emphasize that you are referring to an exact thing, rather than something vague.

example.ex: I can remember the precise moment when my daughter came to see me and her new baby brother in hospital...
example.tran: 我能清楚地回想起我女儿来医院看我和她刚出生的弟弟的那一刻。

example.ex: The precise location of the wreck was discovered in 1988...
example.tran: 残骸的确切位置是在1988年发现的。

entry.def: Something that is precise is exact and accurate in all its details.

example.tran: 他们讲一口非常地道的英语。

example.ex: He does not talk too much and what he has to say is precise and to the point.
example.tran: 他话不多，但他说的话既准确又中肯。

entry.def: You say 'to be precise' to indicate that you are giving more detailed or accurate information than you have just given.

example.ex: More than a week ago, Thursday evening to be precise, Susanne was at her evening class...
example.tran: 一个多星期以前，确切地说是周四晚上，苏珊在夜校上课。

example.ex: The restaurant in which we ate that night had more people in it at 11pm, 51 more to be precise, than it did at 10pm.
example.tran: 那天晚上我们去吃饭的那家餐馆晚上11点时比10点时人更多，准确地说多了51人。

means.word_mean: 1. sharply exact or accurate or delimited;
2. (of ideas, images, representations, expressions) characterized by perfect conformity to fact or truth ; strictly correct;

stems_affixes.word_buile: pre在……前的,预先+built建造的,build的过去式和过去分词→adj.预制的
pre在……前的,预先+car=care关心+ious……的→要预先关心的→冒险的
pre在……前的,预先+cise切→预先切好的→精确的
pre在……前的,预先+coc=coct煮+ious……的→提前煮熟→早熟的
pre在……前的,预先+school学校→上学前的
pre在……前的,预先+sci知道+ent表形容词→预先知道
pre在……前的,预先+amble跑→跑在前面→前言
pre在……前的,预先+caution小心→预先小心→预防
pre在……前的,预先+ced走+ent人或物等→走在前面的东西→先例
pre在……前的,预先+cept拿→以前拿好的[名言]→格言
pre在……前的,预先+cinct捆→预先捆好的→范围
pre在……前的,预先+cipice头→在前面是尽头→峭壁
pre在……前的,预先+cipit头→ation→落在前头→降落,下降
pre在……前的,预先+destination目的地→预先定好的目的地→命中注定
pre在……前的,预先+disposition性情→性情预定→癖性
pre在……前的,预先+fix固定→固定在前面→前缀
pre在……前的,预先+history历史→n.史前
pre在……前的,预先+occup占有+ation表名词→优先占有[注意力]→全神贯注
pre在……前的,预先+position位置→位置放在前面→前置词
pre在……前的,预先+rog要求+ative表名词→预先要求→[有]特权
pre在……前的,预先+ced走+e→走在前面→[时间上]先于
pre在……前的,预先+clud关闭+e→提前关闭→阻止
pre在……前的,预先+dict说→预先说→预言
pre在……前的,预先+fer带来→先带来→更喜欢
pre在……前的,预先+pay付钱→v.预付
con全部+cise切开,杀→把[没用的东西]全部切掉
de加强+cise切开,杀+ive……的→adj.决定性的
incise[v.切,切割]+ive……的→切人的→一针见血的
pre预先+cise切开,杀→预先切好→精确的
excise[v.割去,删去]+ion动作或状态→n.删除,灭绝;切除
incise[v.切,切割]+or物→切[咬]东西的东西→incisor门牙
precise[adj.精确的,清楚的]+ion表名词→n.精密,正确
circum环绕+cise切开,杀→切一圈
ex出+cise切开,杀→v.割去,删去
in进入+cise切开,杀→切进去

Sentence.sentence: No one knows the precise use Google will make of the intellectual property it has gained by scanning the world's library books, and the truth, as Gleick, an American science writer and member of the Authors Guild, points out, is that the company probably doesn't even know itself.

means.word_mean: 精确的, 准确的, 确切的, 明确的

sentences.en: A scientist must be precise in making tests.
sentences.cn: 科学家做试验必须精确。

sentences.en: At the precise moment that I put my foot on the step, the bus started.
sentences.cn: 恰好就在我登上公共汽车台阶的时候, 车开动了。

means.word_mean: 周密的, 细密的, 精细的, 细致的, 认真的, 一丝不苟的

sentences.cn: 律师需要有周密的头脑。
